meanings.definition: To make something mobile or capable of movement.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic will mobilise the car for the road trip.
meanings.sent2: We need to mobilise the troops for the upcoming mission.
meanings.sent3: The toys mobilised themselves for a race around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her words mobilised the crowd to take action.
meanings.sent5: The wind will mobilise the leaves to dance in the air.

meanings.definition: To assemble or prepare for action or use.
meanings.sent1: Let's mobilise all the ingredients before we start cooking.
meanings.sent2: The team will mobilise for the important presentation.
meanings.sent3: The students mobilised their pens for the exam battle.
meanings.sent4: His speech mobilised the audience to support the cause.
meanings.sent5: The sun will mobilise the clouds for a beautiful sunset.

meanings.definition: To organize or coordinate resources for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The event planner will mobilise the vendors for the festival.
meanings.sent2: We must mobilise our efforts to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The ants mobilised their teamwork to carry the food back to the nest.
meanings.sent4: She mobilised her contacts to make the project successful.
meanings.sent5: The conductor will mobilise the musicians for the concert.
